name: Global Family Day
description: A day proclaimed by the United Nations to be celebrated every year on 1 January. The day is meant to reflect on the importance of families and their well-being.
funFact: It grew out of the celebration of the 'One Day of Peace' observed in various countries since the mid-1990s.

name: Pi Day
description: An annual celebration of the mathematical constant π (pi). Pi Day is observed on March 14 (3/14 in the month/day date format), since 3, 1, and 4 are the first three significant digits of π.
funFact: In 2009, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a non-binding resolution recognizing March 14 as National Pi Day.

name: Star Wars Day
description: An informal commemorative day observed annually on May 4 to celebrate the Star Wars media franchise. The date is a pun on the Star Wars catchphrase 'May the Force be with you' as 'May the Fourth be with you'.
funFact: The first recorded use of the phrase 'May the Fourth be with you' was in 1979, the day Margaret Thatcher became Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

name: Talk Like a Pirate Day
description: A parodic holiday invented in 1995 by John Baur and Mark Summers of Albany, Oregon, U.S., proclaiming September 19 of every year as the day when everyone should talk like a pirate.
funFact: The founders chose September 19 because it was the only date during the year that one of them could easily remember.

name: International Tongue Twister Day
description: A day to celebrate the fun and challenge of tongue twisters. It's a great opportunity to try and master some of the trickiest phrases!
funFact: The Guinness World Record for the fastest time to recite a difficult tongue twister is held by Fran Capo, who said 'She sells seashells by the seashore' in 7.01 seconds.
